title: Chamara Silva appointed as Sri Lanka U19 Head Coach
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) appointed Chamara Silva as the Head Coach of the Sri Lanka U19 National Team.

title: Flight from LA to Shanghai turns back after pilot forgets passport
byline: A United Airlines plane that left the United States for China on the weekend had to make an unexpected diversion because the pilot forgot to bring his passport.

title: New gazette sets maximum retail price for medicines
byline: An Extraordinary Gazette Notification has been issued to implement a maximum retail price mechanism for medicines.

title: Russia and Ukraine agree naval ceasefire in Black Sea
byline: Russia and Ukraine have agreed to a naval ceasefire in the Black Sea in separate deals with the US, after three days of peace talks in Saudi Arabia.

title: Sri Lanka among top Eid getaways for Omani travellers
byline: Sri Lanka has emerged as one of the most sought-after international destinations for travellers in Oman this Eid season, according to Travel and Tour World (TTW).

title: CBSL keeps Overnight Policy Rate (OPR) unchanged
byline: The Monetary Policy Board decided to keep the Overnight Policy Rate (OPR) at 8.00 peecent at its meeting held yesterday.

title: Apparel exporters fear over  US$1 bn loss as SVAT abolition looms
byline: Sri Lanka’s apparel exporters are expressing serious concerns that the impending abolition of the Simplified Value Added Tax (SVAT) system could lead to a significant downturn in their export earnings, potentially exceeding US$1 billion.

title: Kelaniya University Senior Lecturer’s wife too succumbs to injuries from accident
byline: The wife of Dr. N.D.G. Gayantha, Head of the Psychology Unit at the Department of Philosophy, University of Kelaniya, also succumbed to her injuries while receiving treatment at the hospital today.

title: Govt to act against extremist group in Eastern Province
byline: While questioning the Muslim extremist group operating in the Eastern Province, Cabinet spokesman and Minister Nalinda Jayatissa stated that legal action will be taken against the group following investigations.

title: Cabinet nod to provide essential food package during festive season
byline: In line with the proposal submitted under the Budget 2025, the government has announced plans to provide an essential food package at a concessionary price during the upcoming Sinhala and Tamil New Year festival season.

title: Remittances from Sri Lankan workers surge by 16.3%
byline: While recording a 16.3% rise, foreign remittances sent through the banking system by Sri Lankan workers saw a significant increase by the end of February this year, the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLFEB) said.

title: Starlink internet to launch in Sri Lanka this April
byline: Elon Musk’s Starlink satellite internet services will be available in Sri Lanka starting in April, as stated by the Director General of the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL), Cabinet spokesman and Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Govt. plans to develop Nuwara Eliya post office as tourist attraction
byline: The government plans to develop the Nuwara Eliya Post Office as a tourist attraction while continuing to offer postal services, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Foreign Ministry to announce Govt. stance on UK sanctions
byline: Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today the Ministry of Foreign Affairs will announce the government’s stance regarding the UK’s decision to impose sanctions on four individuals, including three Sri Lankan military leaders.

title: UK sanctions: Such unilateral actions only complicate reconciliation process: Foreign Ministry
byline: In response to the UK sanction on the Sri Lankan officials including three former military leaders, the Foreign Ministry said today that such unilateral actions by countries do not assist but serve to complicate the national reconciliation process underway in Sri Lanka.

title: Gnanasara Thera should share terrorist group info with CID: Minister
byline: If Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) General Secretary Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera has information regarding an operational terrorist group beyond what is known to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), he can hand it over to them, Cabinet spokesman and Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Wartime President Mahinda Rajapaksa tells off UK for sanctions against military leaders
byline: Leader of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Mahinda Rajapaksa who was the Executive of President during the wartime told off the UK over sanctions against former Chief of Defence Staff Shavendra Silva, former Navy Commander Wasantha Karannagoda and former Army Commander Jagath Jayasuriya over unproven allegations of human rights violations during the war with the LTTE.

title: Terrifying video shows two French jets colliding mid-air
byline: Three people were ’’found conscious’’ after two jets from the French air force’s acrobatics team apparently collided near an air base in northeastern France on Tuesday, authorities said.

title: Four suspects arrested over nightclub brawl
byline: Four suspects have surrendered to the Colombo (Central) Crimes Investigation Bureau in connection with the brawl that took place at the Octopussy nightclub on Park Street in Colombo over the weekend.

title: The UK sanctions on military leaders: Govt weighs response
byline: Sri Lanka is weighing its response to the UK government’s decision to impose sanctions on three Sri Lankan military leaders and one time LTTE military wing leader in the east Vinayagamurthy Muralitharan alias Karuna Amman who defected from the terrorist organization and joined hands with the then government, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Sathasivam Viyalendran arrested
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has arrested former State Minister Sathasivam Viyalendran.

title: No proven ways to stop crocodiles from reaching shore: Official
byline: It is not practical, nor is there a scientifically proven method to prevent crocodiles from arriving at the coastline, and it has become a common occurrence, a Wild Life Department official said.

title: StanChart to exit wealth & retail banking business in SL
byline: Standard Chartered Group, as a part of its strategy, said it is exploring the sale of its Wealth & Retail Banking (WRB) business in Sri Lanka, subject to regulatory approvals.

title: Two Welikada police constables among those arrested in Rs. 1.6 million robbery
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali ordered the detention of two police constables attached to the Welikada Police and two other suspects for 48 hours to facilitate further investigations into an abduction, assault and robbery amounting to Rs. 1.6 million.

title: Nearly 40 donors register at Sperm Bank
byline: Nearly 40 donors have already been registered at the sperm bank of the Castle Street Hospital for Women in Colombo, Hospital Director Dr. Ajith Kumara Danthanarayana said.

title: CA further extends status quo for ex-CCD OIC in Weligama shooting incident
byline: The Court of Appeal further extended its previous order to maintain the status quo for former Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) Director Neville de Silva in connection with the Weligama hotel shooting incident.

title: Concerns rise over health-related issues among school children
byline: Concerns are being raised over health-related behaviours among children, with 18% mostly in the 16-17 age group experiencing feelings of depression, according to the Health Promotion Bureau.

title: FMM asks Govt. to ensure accountability in proposed reforms to state media
byline: The Free Media Movement (FMM) today asked the government to ensure accountability in implementing proposed reforms to the three state media institutions and disclose it to the public if there’s any.

title: Exposition of Sacred Tooth Relic of Buddha will ensure religious harmony: Cardinal
byline: The exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic of the Buddha will ensure religious harmony in Sri Lanka while it helps safeguard Buddhism which is the backbone of national heritage, Archbishop of Colombo Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith said today.

title: Need to create trend to encourage tax payments: Deputy Minister
byline: A trend must be created in the country to motivate people to pay their taxes, Deputy Minister of Labour and Economic Development A. Anil Jayanta Fernando said.
